title: I.Phrases
stimulusHtml:
Phrases (9 points, 3 points per phrase)

  1. For each two-measure phrase you may award up to 3 points using the guide below.

    Bass Melody: good
    Harmonies: good to fair
    Score: 3
    Phrase Descriptor: very good to excellent

    Bass Melody: good
    Harmonies: poor, incorrect, inappropriate, or none
    Score: 2
    Phrase Descriptor: fair to good

    Bass Melody: fair
    Harmonies: good to fair
    Score: 2
    Phrase Descriptor: fair to good

    Bass Melody: fair
    Harmonies: poor, incorrect, inappropriate, or none
    Score: 1
    Phrase Descriptor: weak

    Bass Melody: poor or none
    Harmonies: very good
    Score: 2
    Phrase Descriptor: fair to good

    Bass Melody: poor or none
    Harmonies: fair
    Score: 1
    Phrase Descriptor: weak

    Bass Melody: poor or none
    Harmonies: poor, incorrect, inappropriate, or none
    Score: 0
    Phrase Descriptor: very poor

  2. When examining each phrase consider that:

    1. The bass should consist of only eighth, quarter, dotted quarter, half, and dotted half notes. A whole note is permitted in the last measure.

    2. There should be at least two chords per bar. Inversions of the same harmony are acceptable.

    3. Inversions and seventh chords are acceptable, if used appropriately.

    4. Parallel octaves or fifths are considered to be more egregious than the following errors:

      1. direct fifths or octaves, if approached by leap in both voices

      2. inappropriate or poor treatment of the leading tone

      3. unresolved sevenths or incorrectly resolved sevenths

      4. excessive or inappropriate leaps (e.g., TT, A2, 7th, 9th, or larger)

      5. implied inappropriate ("drive-by") six-four chords

      6. repeated notes over a barline

      7. similar motion to a fifth or an octave when the skip is in the upper voice

    5. Inner voices, if notated, should be ignored

    6. In most cases, 2 points should be the maximum awarded for a phrase which has:

      1. a totally inappropriate cadence

      2. excessive parallel fifths or octaves

title: II Aesthetic Point
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Aesthetic Point (1 point)

You may award one point for truly musical responses.

Scores with additional meaning

1 A response that earns a zero using I and II above but which has some redeeming qualities.

0 A response which demonstrates an attempt to answer the question but which has no redeeming qualities.
